variants.Description in input context: E46K mutation in α-synuclein linked to familial Parkinson's disease

Material used.Material Name: Recombinant α-synuclein (wt and E46K mutant), Synthetic GBD peptides
Material used.Description: Recombinant proteins (wt and E46K mutant of α-syn) and synthetic GBD peptides were used to measure interactions with GM3 monolayers at the air-water interface.

Readout description.Result Description: The E46K mutant showed a higher affinity for GM3 monolayers compared to wild-type α-synuclein, with a maximal surface pressure increase of 12.3 mN/m versus 7.6 mN/m for wild-type.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Surface pressure increase similar to wild-type α-synuclein (approximately 7.6 mN/m).

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Surface pressure increase significantly higher than wild-type α-synuclein (e.g., 12.3 mN/m for E46K).

Material used.Material Name: Recombinant α-synuclein (wt and E46K mutant), DOPC, DOPC-GM3, DOPC-GM1, DOPC-GM1-GM3 bilayers
Material used.Description: Recombinant α-synuclein proteins (wt and E46K mutant) were added to reconstituted planar lipid bilayers made of DOPC alone or with gangliosides (GM3, GM1, or both) to study ion channel formation.

Readout description.Result Description: In DOPC bilayers, E46K mutant channels showed lower conductance (35 pS vs. 150 pS for wt), nonstop activity, and higher cation selectivity. In DOPC-GM3 bilayers, E46K conductance increased to 166 pS, resembling wild-type behavior in DOPC, indicating a corrective effect of GM3.

Biological replicates.Description: All bilayer experiments were performed at least five times under each condition.

Technical replicates.Description: Each voltage condition was repeated five times for dwell time analysis.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Mean log dwell time and open probability (Po) calculated from five bilayers under each condition.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Channel conductance and dwell time similar to wild-type α-synuclein in DOPC bilayers (e.g., conductance of 150 pS, mean dwell time around 1.4 ms).

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Channel conductance significantly lower than wild-type (e.g., 35 pS for E46K in DOPC), with nonstop activity and altered dwell times (e.g., 67 ms and 109 ms).
